Yes, in the "Dabba Mallaputta Sutta," Dabba the Mallian is said to have had the ability to "enter the fire element." According to the sutta, he was able to do this by focusing his mind on the impermanence of all things, and by practicing mindfulness and concentration. This allowed him to overcome fear and attachment to his physical body, and to endure physical hardships without suffering.

The ability to enter the fire element is seen as a metaphor for the spiritual attainment of a higher state of consciousness, where one is able to transcend worldly concerns and attain a state of peace and liberation. In Buddhist teachings, such spiritual attainments are seen as a result of spiritual practice and development, rather than as a result of any supernatural powers or abilities.
